summary: This is an email chain between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and a contractor, discussing technical issues with a non-searchable PDF. The document is the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) draft report regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in 2006-2008.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the OPR draft report being discussed, which investigates the handling of his case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Handling of Epstein matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period under review by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: OPR transmits draft report to SDNY
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility sends its draft report on the Epstein matter to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.
The draft report was transmitted to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
The attached report was a large document (over 400 pages total) with a ~30-page searchable appendix, but the main ~370-page report was not searchable, causing technical issues for the recipients.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to make the OPR report technically usable.
